jto.p5graphtheory

Class Graph.DisjointSet<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jto.p5graphtheory.Graph.DisjointSet<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E -
    Enclosing class:
    Graph

    public static class Graph.DisjointSet<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the DisjointSet class. This is a simple implementation of a disjoint set data structure for use in the minimal spanning tree algorithm of the Graph class.
    The structure is esentially a LinkedList of LinkedLists.

    I've made this class public in case anyone who hasn't ever used this kind of data structure wants to mess around with it.
    Version:
    2012.08.14
    Author:
    J. Taylor O'Connor

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.LinkedList<E> find(E element)
      This returns the LinkedList in the list of LinkedLists that contains the element specified, or null if none of the lists contain the element.
      void makeSet(E singleton)
      This creates a new LinkedList that contains the one object that is the parameter, and adds it to the list of LinkedLists.
      void union(E a, E b)
      This method takes the list containing b and appends it to the list containing a.

    • Method Detail

      • makeSet

        public void makeSet(E singleton)
        This creates a new LinkedList that contains the one object that is the parameter, and adds it to the list of LinkedLists.
        Parameters:
        singleton - the single data member that will make up the new LinkedList.

      • union

        public void union(E a,
         E b)
        This method takes the list containing b and appends it to the list containing a. Then the original list containing b is removed from the overall list of LinkedLists.
        Parameters:
        a - the member whose list will get b's list appended to it.
        b - the member whose list will be appended to a's list.

      • find

        public java.util.LinkedList<E> find(E element)
        This returns the LinkedList in the list of LinkedLists that contains the element specified, or null if none of the lists contain the element.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to be found.
        Returns:
        the LinkedList containing the element.
